hero.title: Thomas Roger Lux.
hero.title2: I build stuff for the web.
hero.subtitle: I'm a developer based in Paris, France.
hero.subtitle2: I can build your project from the first line of code to the production.

backend.title: Back-end Developer
backend.description: I worked on NodeJS micro-services, Golang GraphQL APIs and Django based Python backends. Don't have any problem with SQL based databases, even exotic ones such as CockroachDB. If you prefer document based ones, like Mongo, that's good too.

devops.title: DevOps Engineer
devops.description: Setting up an Infrastructure as Code environment with Terraform and Ansible to deploy your Docker based containers? No problem. If what you need is a more classic CI, I'm capable with GitlabCI, Github Actions or even CircleCI.

frontend.title: Front-end Developer
frontend.description: I know by heart React's API, had my fair share of time with Angular (v2+) and know much more than the basics of CSS/HTML. I code my fronts in Typescript and worked on mobile hybrid projects based on React Native and Flutter.

qantev.title: QantEv
qantev.description: After my return to France in 2020, I started working at QantEv, a Station F's based startup. There, I got the opportunity to develop my skills with Python based backends, refine my knowledge of React, and experience my first professional DevOps jobs. Somehow I also found the time to try myself at some light project management and UX/UI design.

indigen.title: Indigen Solutions
indigen.description: I worked at Indigen Solutions starting 2017 until mid-2019 thanks to a couple of internships and a part-time job. This was my first work experience, where I got the opportunity to explore the world of full stack Javascript/Typescript, with NodeJS backends, ReactJS frontends, and React Native mobile apps.

inha.title: Inha University
inha.description: Spent one year following classes of the computer engineering major at Inha University (South Korea) and studied mostly computer security and networks. Also got used to speak English as my main language and found some time to follow business and marketing classes, for fun.

epitech.title: Epitech
epitech.description: I started my master in computer science at the Epitech School (France) in 2016. With a cursus centered around projects and practice, I studied Linux internals as well as C and C++ and got the opportunity to apply for tons of internships.
